etymology.description: 豆 (bean) + 浆/漿 (thick liquid) = soy milk
etymology.interpretation: Refers to a thick beverage made by grinding and boiling soybeans, i.e., soy milk. Commonly served at breakfast, often paired with youtiao.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 豆漿 → Simplified 豆浆; 漿 was simplified to 浆 by adopting the simplified phonetic 将 and streamlining the water component to reduce strokes.

parts.english: thick liquid; slurry; paste; starch solution

examples.chinese: 我每天早上喝一杯热豆浆(我每天早上喝一杯熱豆漿)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān zǎoshang hē yì bēi rè dòujiāng.
examples.english: I drink a cup of hot soy milk every morning.

examples.chinese: 在中国北方(在中國北方)，豆浆常配油条(豆漿常配油條)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngguó běifāng, dòujiāng cháng pèi yóutiáo.
examples.english: In northern China, soy milk is often served with fried dough sticks.

examples.chinese: 自己在家用黄豆打豆浆很方便(自己在家用黃豆打豆漿很方便)。
examples.pinyin: Zìjǐ zài jiā yòng huángdòu dǎ dòujiāng hěn fāngbiàn.
examples.english: It’s very convenient to make soy milk at home with soybeans.
